I think it's really cool how Harry was able to form such a strong bond with his owl, and it's amazing how much trust he had in it to carry out important tasks.

I've heard that Flitwick is a female character in the Harry Potter series. I think it's interesting that J.K. Rowling chose to make her one of the few female professors at Hogwarts, showing that even in a traditionally male-dominated field, women can excel and be respected leaders.
